alert.note: Alert for East Glacier Park Region; Southern Rocky Mountain Front (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 19 at 3:17AM MST until February 22 at 11:00PM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THIS MORNING TO 11 PM MST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 6 and 12 inches possible from Rogers Pass southward. Snow accumulations between 12 and 24 inches along the Rocky Mountain Front. Winds gusting over 50 mph at times. * WHERE...The Continental Divide along the Rocky Mountain Front. * WHEN...From 11 AM this morning to 11 PM MST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible and tire chains may be required for some vehicles. Those in the backcountry should ensure they have appropriate knowledge and gear and may want to consider alternate plans. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Blowing snow will significantly reduce visibility at times.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or visiting the MDT Road Report website. To see a graphical representation of the degree of stress on young livestock please visit our webpage and select Local Programs then Cold Air Advisory for Newborn Livestock.

area.areaDesc: East Glacier Park Region; Southern Rocky Mountain Front
